filmography.title: An Unseen Enemy
filmography.role_description: A resourceful young woman who, along with her sister, is trapped in a room by a thieving housekeeper brandishing a gun.
filmography.plot: Two sisters try to protect their inheritance from a greedy housekeeper and her burglar accomplice in this D.W. Griffith thriller.

filmography.title: The Musketeers of Pig Alley
filmography.role_description: A poor young wife living in the New York tenements who becomes the object of a gangster's protection.
filmography.plot: A young musician's wife is harassed by gangsters but finds an unlikely protector in the local crime boss.

filmography.title: The Mothering Heart
filmography.role_description: A devoted wife who faces heartbreak when her husband abandons her for a glamour girl, and tragedy strikes their child.
filmography.plot: A young wife struggles to win back her straying husband after he is seduced by "idle women" at a cabaret.

filmography.title: Judith of Bethulia
filmography.role_description: A young mother struggling to care for her baby during the brutal siege of her city.
filmography.plot: A brave widow infiltrates the camp of an Assyrian general to save her city from destruction.

filmography.title: The Birth of a Nation
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a Northern abolitionist who falls in love with a Southern Confederate officer amidst the chaos of the Civil War and Reconstruction.
filmography.plot: Two families, Northern and Southern, are intertwined during the Civil War and Reconstruction eras in this controversial epic.

filmography.title: Intolerance
filmography.role: The Woman Who Rocks the Cradle
filmography.role_description: A symbolic figure representing eternal motherhood who links the four historical stories together.
filmography.plot: Four separate stories from different historical eras are intercut to depict humanity's struggle against intolerance.

filmography.title: Hearts of the World
filmography.role_description: A French village girl who suffers the brutality of war when her home is occupied by German forces.
filmography.plot: Two lovers in a French village are torn apart by the outbreak of World War I.

filmography.title: Broken Blossoms
filmography.role_description: A gentle, abused girl living in the London slums who finds a brief respite of kindness from a Chinese immigrant.
filmography.plot: A young girl is beaten by her prizefighter father and finds sanctuary with a gentle Chinese shopkeeper.

filmography.title: True Heart Susie
filmography.role_description: A simple, self-sacrificing country girl who secretly sells her cow to pay for her childhood sweetheart's college education.
filmography.plot: A naive country girl secretly supports the boy she loves, only to see him return from college and marry someone else.

filmography.title: Way Down East
filmography.role_description: A wronged woman with a secret past who is cast out into a blizzard, leading to a famous rescue on an icy river.
filmography.plot: A naive country girl is tricked into a sham marriage and has an illegitimate child, leading to her ostracization.

filmography.title: Orphans of the Storm
filmography.role_description: One of two orphaned sisters separated during the French Revolution, who must navigate the Reign of Terror to reunite.
filmography.plot: Two sisters, one blind and one sighted, are separated in the turmoil of the French Revolution.

filmography.title: The White Sister
filmography.role_description: An Italian aristocrat who becomes a nun after believing her lover has been killed in the war.
filmography.plot: A woman enters a convent after her lover is reported dead, only for him to return alive years later.

filmography.title: La Bohème
filmography.role_description: A seamstress in 1830s Paris who suffers in poverty for the love of a playwright.
filmography.plot: The tragic love story of a seamstress and a struggling artist in the Latin Quarter of Paris.

filmography.title: The Scarlet Letter
filmography.role_description: A Puritan woman who is forced to wear a scarlet 'A' for adultery but refuses to name the father of her child.
filmography.plot: In 17th-century Boston, a woman is persecuted for bearing an illegitimate child and refusing to reveal the father's identity.

filmography.title: The Wind
filmography.role_description: A sheltered Virginia girl who is driven to the brink of madness by the relentless wind and harsh life of the Texas prairies.
filmography.plot: A naive young woman moves to West Texas, where the constant wind and a forced marriage threaten her sanity.

filmography.title: One Romantic Night
filmography.role_description: A princess who must choose between her duty to marry a crown prince and her love for a tutor; Gish's first talkie.
filmography.plot: A princess is pressured to marry a prince but finds herself falling for her brothers' tutor.

filmography.title: His Double Life
filmography.role_description: A woman who marries a famous artist, unaware that he has assumed the identity of his deceased valet to escape fame.
filmography.plot: A famous painter fakes his own death and assumes his valet's identity to live a quiet life with a new wife.

filmography.title: Commandos Strike at Dawn
filmography.role_description: A Norwegian woman who supports the resistance movement against Nazi occupation in her fishing village.
filmography.plot: After Nazis occupy a Norwegian village, a peaceful man leads a commando raid to destroy a German airfield.

filmography.title: Duel in the Sun
filmography.role_description: The refined, long-suffering wife of a tyrannical cattle baron who tries to keep peace between her husband and sons.
filmography.plot: A half-Native American woman causes a rift between two brothers on a Texas ranch.

filmography.title: Portrait of Jennie
filmography.role_description: A kindly nun who provides spiritual guidance and confirms the mysterious history of the title character.
filmography.plot: A struggling artist meets a mysterious young girl in Central Park who seems to age years every time they meet.

filmography.title: The Cobweb
filmography.role_description: A dour and fussy clinic administrator who battles with staff over the budget for new drapes.
filmography.plot: Staff and patients at a psychiatric clinic clash over drapes for the library, revealing deep personal dysfunctions.

filmography.title: The Night of the Hunter
filmography.role_description: A tough, gun-toting farm woman who protects two runaway children from a murderous preacher.
filmography.plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid the $10,000 he'd stolen.

filmography.title: The Unforgiven
filmography.role_description: A frontier mother who desperately hides the secret of her adopted daughter's Native American heritage.
filmography.plot: The neighbors of a frontier family turn on them when it is suspected that their adopted daughter was stolen from the local Kiowa tribe.

filmography.title: The Comedians
filmography.role_description: An innocent, vegetarian wife of a presidential candidate who gets caught up in the political turmoil of Haiti.
filmography.plot: The cynical owner of a hotel in Haiti becomes involved with a group of rebels and the wife of a foreign ambassador.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: A Wedding
filmography.role_description: The matriarch of a wealthy family who dies early in the film, setting off a chain of chaotic events.
filmography.plot: The wedding of a nouveau riche man and old money woman turns into a disaster of hidden family secrets and scandals.

filmography.title: Sweet Liberty
filmography.role_description: The eccentric, elderly mother of the protagonist who believes the Devil lives in her kitchen.
filmography.plot: A history professor's life is turned upside down when a Hollywood crew arrives to film a movie adaptation of his book.

filmography.title: The Whales of August
filmography.role_description: An elderly woman who cares for her bitter, blind sister in their Maine summer home; Gish's final film role.
filmography.plot: Two elderly sisters, one blind and bitter, the other sweet and patient, reflect on their lives and possible futures while vacationing in Maine.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actress
